summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons (BOP) administrative dashboard report showing statistics for inmates in Special Housing Units (SHU) and Administrative Detention (AD) status across the Northeast Region, generated on August 12, 2019. It provides a snapshot of inmate population counts and status categories at various federal facilities.
keyFacts: The report is dated August 12, 2019, which is shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, though the report itself does not mention him.
It is a system-generated statistical dashboard showing inmate counts in Special Housing Units (SHU) and Administrative Detention (AD) status across multiple federal prisons.
The report includes data for the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn (MDC), where Jeffrey Epstein was previously held.
The data categorizes inmates by various statuses including protective custody, pending investigations, and disciplinary segregation.
This appears to be a routine administrative report, not directly focused on Epstein, but part of a larger document set.
